PHRASE: LDAP PasswordComparisonAuthenticator now supports salted-SHA passwords

Simplify customizing OAuth2AuthorizationRequest, Although this strategy could fulfill most (if not all) use cases, it does require some extra configuration that may not be as convenient compared to directly "hooking" into the OAuth2AuthorizationRequest.Builder for customizations.
Introduce AuthenticationConverterServerWebExchangeMatcher, It can be used as a matcher where SecurityFilterChain should be matched based on used authentication method.
Add BCrypt byte[] APIs, additional tests

Make getters of handlers publically accessible, Changes AbstractAuthenticationProcessingFilter getters of success and failure handlers to public visibility so that allowSessionCreation flag can be configured, see also gh-11053.

Enable customization of BearerTokenResolver by adding a setter for JwtClaimIssuerConverter on JwtIssuerAuthenticationManagerResolver, I use the JwtIssuerAuthenticationManagerResolver in a web socket backend which receives the JWT not in the Authorization Header but in a custom X-Authorization Cookie Header. Therefore, I need to use my own BearerTokenResolver implementation which gets the JWT from there. This seems not to be possible at the moment.
Application will crash if no available internet access since commit 2e63def

The first commit fixes incomplete commit e68d8bf in context with gh-234.
e68d8bf added a private field providedSessionAuthenticationStrategy but missed to set it somewhere.
The second commit improves the possibilities to configure session management.
In my opinion it's kind of surprising that setting session authorization disables session fixation.

"Adds support for JWSKeySelector introspection given a valid JWK Set."
"This PR adds support for creating a JWSVerificationKeySelector dynamically based on the availability of JWK algorithms from a given JWK Set provided by an OIDC discovery document (7160). Non-standard or unknown algorithms will be silently ignored (see SignatureAlgorithm class). A warning log has also been added to let developers know if there was a problem fetching the JWK Set, although this does not halt the application from starting. The original functionality is still in place that adds the RS256 algorithm if none are provided during initial configuration for backwards compatibility. A new unit test as well as an extended mock JWK set for verification."

PHRASE:
Add Generic AuthenticationFilter

the AbstractAuthenticationProcessingFilter.requiresAuthentication() method modified here to throw exceptions because these exceptions declared for AbstractAuthenticationProcessingFilter.unsuccessfulAuthentication method, which need to be called within GenericAuthenticationFilter.requiresAuthentication in case of AuthenticationConverter.convert decides to throw the AuthenticationException. So this seems necessary to have this change.

PHRASE: "Add client support for PKCE", "Bottom line: I don't think this is the target use-case for spring security client PKCE support but could be used in theory.", "thereby making the client_secret unviable and PKCE a good fit. Turning non-web apps into web ones feels a bit heavy but simple.","These authorization request", "We probably don't need PKCE support.", "Is this the best way to determine if PKCE should be used? This seems implicit rather than explicit which can lead to problems later on (if there are other reasons the client secret can be empty). Additionally implicit options in security tends to lead to security vulnerabilities.", "PKCE is meant to be used for Public Clients leveraging the Authorization Code grant. Public Clients are not assigned full credentials (no client secret). So I guess I'm confused with what the user is saying.", "Looking at the Okta developer guide for Authorization Code Flow with PKCE, you will see that the client authentication is not required (so no client_secret).", "And for the standard Authorization Code Flow, you will see that the client authentication is required as this flow is targeted for confidential clients.","The current best practices for OAuth security specifies that PKCE should also be used for webapps:", "supported by popular OAuth 2.0 Providers. ", so on
KEYWORDS: PKCE, security, oauth2, client_secret, vulnerabilities, public clients, authorization
OBS: Discussão bem interessante

PHRASE: "In case you don't use a message digest - leaking the length of the password could be useful for an attacker.", "Some of this has to do with the complexities of cryptography", "Clearly it should. When dealing with frameworks especially, framework developers should address all known security vulnerabilities because one cannot possibly be aware of all your client's threat models.", "Also, the timing differences per character are sub-nanosecond IIRC. Very very small. So unless you're on the local network with a vulnerable string comparison running on a slow 8-bit processor (think IoT), then you're probably not vulnerable.", "So it would seem if we want to prevent the length from leaking,", "In shared hosting, one can't guarantee that an attacker does not have an instance on the same LAN or even on the same host as the victim.'
KEYWORDS: leaking, password, attacker, cryptography, vulnerabilities, threat, vulnerable, leaking, victim

"Override the key to avoid CookieTheftException"
"Detect authorization bearer token properly" "DefaultBearerTokenResolver has a bug that makes it miss authorization bearer tokens, if the "Bearer" is written in lower case as "bearer"."
OBS: o contexto é de segurança, mas entendi como um problema de robustez por não tratar lowercase

PHRASE:
"Add support for dynamic JWS signature algorithm with JWKs (2)"
"This PR adds support for creating a JWSVerificationKeySelector dynamically based on the availability of JWK algorithms from a given JWK Set provided by an OIDC discovery document (Issue 7160). Non-standard or unknown algorithms will be silently ignored (see SignatureAlgorithm class). A warning log has also been added to let developers know if there was a problem fetching the JWK Set, although this does not halt the application from starting."
KEYWORDS: "JWS" "JWK" "non-standard or unknown alorithms will be silently ignored"
